Intervention: Determination of estrogen levels in blood samples from patients being treated with triptorelin plus tamoxifen for 5 years.
Determination of estrogen levels in blood samples from patients being treated with triptorelin plus exemestane for 5 years.
Eligibility: Concurrent enrollment on clinical trial IBCSG-2402 (SOFT trial) required
Randomized to receive triptorelin in combination with either tamoxifen citrate or exemestane
Estrogen receptor- and/or progesterone receptor-positive tumor
Results: Estrogen Levels (Estradiol [E2], Estrone [E1], and Estrone Sulphate [E1S]) at Different Time Points During the First 4 Years of Treatment With Triptorelin (Trip) in Combination With Either Tamoxifen (T) or Exemestane (E), IBCSG 24-02 SOFT-EST Substudy

Estrogen levels (estradiol [E2], estrone [E1], and estrone sulphate [E1S]) were measured at the following time points for the SOFT-EST: 0 (baseline), 3, 6, 12, 18, 24, 36, and 48 months after randomization. Some of these samples were not used, including un-scheduled sample, post surgery or vaginal bleeding, samples taken post early discontinuation (ED) or discontinuation of GnRH injections.
Time frame: 0 (baseline), 3, 6, 12, 18, 24, 36, and 48 months after randomization
Arm/Group Description: Determination of estrogen levels in blood samples from patients being treated with triptorelin plus tamoxifen for 5 years.
Unit of Measure: pg/mL  Estradiol (E2) levels at baseline (0 months): 26 participants
